The messenger I sent to Brutus just got back Tusculum, yesterday. Servilia told him Brutus had started at June 26, as. half-past six in the morning. I was very sorry he 44 did not get my letters. Silius has not come yet. 1 have drawn up a statement of his case, and am sending the pamphlet to you. Ι should like to know when to expect you.

CICERO TO ATTICUS, GREETING.

Opinions differ about my joui-ney, for I have had a Tusculum,

lot of visitors. But please apply yourself to the June 29, ac. question. lt is a serious matter. Do you approve 44 of my idea of returning by the lst of January? l am open-minded on the subject, provided 1 don’t give any offence. By the way, too, do you know the date of the sacrilege of yore?¹ However that may be, chance will decide the plan of my Journey. So let us leave it in doubt. For a winter journey is most unpleasant, and that was why Ι asked you the date of the mysteries.² Brutus, as you say, Ι think 1 shall see. Iwant to leave here on the last of the month.
